duties_responsibilities.duty: Identify and secure real-world learning experiences for high school students within Philadelphia.
Establish, implement, and refine the workflow for the Workport @ PLC.
Generate high-interest real-world learning opportunities for 250+ students annually.
Recruit and maintain relationships with mentors and upload secured real-world learning opportunities to the online internship management platform.
Support the process around collecting, analyzing, and managing background check documentation for mentors.
Collaborate to monitor school follow-through and support for real-world learning opportunities, as well as support school Partnership Coordinators as needed.
Conduct school and work site visits to evaluate appropriateness and safety of learning/work environments.
Support fundraising for PLC’s real-world learning programs and present work at local conferences.
Support the development, planning, and hosting of the annual Real-World Learning showcases and convenings.
Travel to various locations in the city as needed.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Education, Urban Studies, Community Organizing, or related areas; Master’s degree preferred.
